override.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to use your power or authority to change someone elseâ€™s decision
override.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The EU commission exercised its power to override British policy.
override.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to be regarded as more important than something else
override.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The needs of the mother should not override the needs of the child.
override.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to stop a machine doing something that it does by itself
override.translation[0].definitions[2].e: Can you override the automatic locking system?
override.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to ignore a decision, rule, law etc made by a person or organization with less authority
override.translation[1].definitions[0].e: It has the power to override state banking laws to sell insolvent thrifts.
